lib

Interface Ec2Service


  • public interface Ec2Service
    EC2Service interface. Provide wrapper services for various operations on AWS EC2 API.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • describeAmi

        com.amazonaws.services.ec2.model.Image describeAmi(java.lang.String amiId)
                                            throws com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException,
                                                   com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException
        Describe the details of an AMI image in AWS from the provided AMI ID.
        Parameters:
        amiId - the AMI ID of the Image we want to describe
        Returns:
        the Image object representing the AMI , or NULL if the AMI with the provided ID cannot be found in the current AWS region
        Throws:
        com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException - if error occurred while calling AWS API
        com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException - if error occurred while calling AWS API

      • describeEC2Instance

        com.amazonaws.services.ec2.model.Instance describeEC2Instance(java.lang.String instanceId)
                                                       throws com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException,
                                                              com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException
        Describe the details of an EC2 Instance from an Instance ID.
        Parameters:
        instanceId - the instance ID we want to describe
        Returns:
        an EC2 Instance object representing the Instance, or NULL if the Instance with the given ID cannot be found
        Throws:
        com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException - if error occurred while calling AWS API
        com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException - if error occurred while calling AWS API

      • tagEC2Instance

                    java.lang.String tagKey,
                    java.lang.String tagValue)
             throws com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException,
                    com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add a Tag to the EC2 instance.
        Parameters:
        instanceId - the instance ID we want to tag
        tagKey - the key of the new Tag
        tagValue - the value of the new Tag
        Throws:
        com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException - if error occurred while calling AWS API
        com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException - if error occurred while calling AWS API
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if instanceId or tagKey not provided

      • revokeSecurityGroupInboundRule

        void revokeSecurityGroupInboundRule(java.lang.String securityGroupName,
                                    java.lang.String protocol,
                                    int port,
                                    java.lang.String address)
                             throws com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException,
                                    com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException
        Delete a particular Security Group Inbound rule.
        Parameters:
        securityGroupName - the name of the Security Group
        protocol - the protocol of the rule we want to remove (HTTP, HTTPS, SSH)
        port - the port of the rule
        address - the inbound address of the rule
        Throws:
        com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException - if error occurred while calling AWS API
        com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException - if error occurred while calling AWS API

      • addSecurityGroupInboundRule

        void addSecurityGroupInboundRule(java.lang.String securityGroupName,
                                 java.lang.String protocol,
                                 int port,
                                 java.lang.String address)
                          throws com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException,
                                 com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException
        Add an Inbound rule to a Security Group.
        Parameters:
        securityGroupName - the name of the Security Group
        protocol - the protocol of the rule we want to add (HTTP, HTTPS, SSH)
        port - the port of the rule
        address - the inbound address of the rule
        Throws:
        com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException - if error occurred while calling AWS API
        com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException - if error occurred while calling AWS API

                      throws com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException,
                             com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create an EC2 Instance, using specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        params - a set of parameters for creating the EC2 Instance
        Returns:
        the newly created EC2 Instance ID
        Throws:
        com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException - if error occurred while calling AWS API
        com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException - if error occurred while calling AWS API
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if null parameters provided

      • terminateInstance

        void terminateInstance(java.lang.String instanceId)
                throws com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException,
                       com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException,
                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Terminate an EC2 Instance with the specified Instance ID.
        Parameters:
        instanceId - the Instance ID of the EC2 instance we want to terminate
        Throws:
        com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException - if error occurred while calling AWS API
        com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException - if error occurred while calling AWS API
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid Instance ID provided
